@graph.caption: Holiday Turkish Pasta With Yogurt Sauce. This pasta dish is a HIT at every party because of the creamy, tangy and refreshing yogurt sauce! It's spiked with garlic, herbs, Brussel sprouts and sweet cranberries for the Holidays! Recipe and Video at www.twopurplefigs.com #ad #ChooseChickapea

@graph.name: Holiday Turkish Pasta With Yogurt Sauce • Two Purple Figs
@graph.description: This Holiday Turkish Pasta with Yogurt Sauce recipe is all the deliciousness of Yogurt sauce pasta but with a festive twist on the classic!

@graph.headline: Holiday Turkish Pasta With Yogurt Sauce

@graph.name: Mahy
@graph.description: Mahy has been a culinary instructor for the last ten years, teaching people all about cooking and baking. She's been featured on the Huffington Post, Business Insider, SELF magazine, MSN Food, Yahoo! Food and many more sites. Her food is simple to follow, fresh and always packed with flavor! Read more about her here: https://www.twopurplefigs.com/about-me/

@graph.name: Holiday Turkish Pasta With Yogurt Sauce
@graph.description: It's already here! The Holidays, the family, the food, the gifts, the fun, the JOY! When it comes to food, our  Holiday table is always evolving. We're not one of those families who serve the same food every year, we may repeat some favorites here and there but we don't stick to a full menu. However, this Holiday Turkish Pasta with Yogurt Sauce recipe is one we make every year in different ways! So you can say it's sort of a start to our Holiday tradition, and it's a seriously delicious tradition!
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons of finely minced oregano and parsley
2 cups of yogurt mixed with 2 Tablespoons of cornstarch
Pinch of salt (more or less to taste)
1/3 cup of toasted pine nuts for sprinkling
2 Tablespoons of minced chives and parsley

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 420 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 420 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: Season the Brussel sprouts with salt, nutmeg and olive oil. Toss well and roast for 18-25 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Season the Brussel sprouts with salt, nutmeg and olive oil. Toss well and roast for 18-25 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the chickapea pasta for about 8 minutes until al dente. In the meantime prepare the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the chickapea pasta for about 8 minutes until al dente. In the meantime prepare the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil over medium heat, add in the garlic and herbs. Sautee the mixture for a minute and add in the cranberries. Sautee for an extra minute and add in the yogurt mixed with cornstarch. Lower the heat to medium low and stir until the yogurt sauce starts to bubble. Don't let it boil vigorously, rather keep the heat on medium low or just low and have the sauce gently simmer until you're ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the olive oil over medium heat, add in the garlic and herbs. Sautee the mixture for a minute and add in the cranberries. Sautee for an extra minute and add in the yogurt mixed with cornstarch. Lower the heat to medium low and stir until the yogurt sauce starts to bubble. Don't let it boil vigorously, rather keep the heat on medium low or just low and have the sauce gently simmer until you're ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble the pasta plate by tossing the roast Brussel sprouts with the chickapea pasta on a serving plate. Spoon the yogurt sauce over the pasta without tossing them together. Sprinkle extra cranberries, pine nuts, chives and herbs and finish off with chilli flakes. Serve and enjoy :)
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble the pasta plate by tossing the roast Brussel sprouts with the chickapea pasta on a serving plate. Spoon the yogurt sauce over the pasta without tossing them together. Sprinkle extra cranberries, pine nuts, chives and herbs and finish off with chilli flakes. Serve and enjoy :)
